wikipedia_page.main: Gladys Daniell (8 November 1884 – 26 July 1962) was a British fencer. She competed at the 1924 and 1928 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1924 Summer Olympics
Great Britain at the 1928 Summer Olympics

response: She competed in the women's individual foil at the 1924 Summer Olympics, alongside fellow British fencers Gladys Davis, Gladys Daniell, and Muriel Freeman, as one of 28 women on the British Olympic team and 26 women fencers from all countries at that Olympics. In Olympic pool play, she beat Suzanne Bonnard (Switzerland), but lost to Adelaide Gehrig (US), Grete Heckscher (Denmark), Gizella Tary (Hungary), and Fernande Tassy (France), and did not advance out of her pool.
